abstract_ssm: Carlo Tresca (1879-1943), was an Italian-born anarchist, who emigrated to the United States in 1904. He was a labor organizer, a journalist, and the editor of several Italian language radical newspapers. An opponent of both fascism and Stalinism, he was assassinated in New York City in 1943. The collection consists of a 344 pp. undated  typescript, titled "Autobiography," which covers his life and political activities through the 1920s.
corpname_ssm: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
